us.pserver.revok

Class HttpConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.pserver.revok.HttpConnector

  • public class HttpConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates network informations, like connection port and address and network proxy. It has utility methods for Socket, ServerSocket, InetAddress and HttpClientConnection creation.
    Version:
    1.1 - 201506
    Author:
    Juno Roesler - juno@pserver.com

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_PORT
      DEFAULT_PORT = 9099
      Default network port.
      static int HTTP_CONN_BUFFER_SIZE
      HTTP_CONN_BUFFER_SIZE = 8*1024
      Default buffer size.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpConnector()
      Default no arguments constructor, uses localhost:9099 network address.
      HttpConnector(java.lang.String address)
      Receives connection address and port <address>:<port>.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.apache.http.HttpClientConnection connectHttp()

      Create a bounded ServerSocket connection with this HttpConnector informations.

      Create a bounded network Socket with this HttpConnector informations.

      Creates an InetSocketAddress from this HttpConnector informations.

      Return the network port.

      Return the network protocol from address (i.e: https://localhost:8080/post/).
